p: Rosin-based molecular glass photoresists can be prepared from maleopimaric acid, hydroxylamine, 2-diazo-1-naphthoquinone-4-sulfonyl chloride and unsaturated compounds: vinyl ethyl ether, or dihydropyran, or cyclohexyl vinyl ether, according to Scheme 52 and using such separation methods as filtration, washing and vacuum drying [ 114]. These materials can be applied in photolithography [ 114].
